title: Scenario 7: Colorectal
diagnosis_topic: Rectal Bleeding and Change in Bowel Habits
setup_script: A 52-year-old male presents to your clinic with a 4-month history of intermittent rectal bleeding, change in bowel habits with increasing constipation, and narrow-caliber stools. He also reports a 15-pound unintentional weight loss over the past 6 months. He has no significant past medical history and no family history of colorectal cancer. On digital rectal examination, you palpate a firm, irregular mass approximately 6 cm from the anal verge on the anterior rectal wall. How would you proceed with this patient?

dynamic_flow.reply: Colonoscopy confirms a 4 cm circumferential, ulcerated mass at 6 cm from the anal verge. Biopsy shows moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma.

CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of distant metastases. Pelvic MRI shows a T3N1 rectal cancer with threatened circumferential resection margin (CRM) and extramural vascular invasion (EMVI). There is no involvement of the levator ani muscles or sphincter complex.
What is your recommendation for the initial approach to this locally advanced rectal cancer?
The patient completes neoadjuvant chemoradiation. Repeat MRI shows significant tumor regression with T2N0 disease and clear CRM. What surgical approach would you recommend now?

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident discusses technical aspects of TME
dynamic_flow.reply: Describe the key technical considerations for total mesorectal excision in this mid-rectal cancer.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident doesn't address sphincter preservation
dynamic_flow.reply: The patient is very concerned about the possibility of a permanent colostomy. What factors would influence your decision regarding sphincter preservation?

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident recommends low anterior resection
dynamic_flow.reply: During the operation, after completing TME and transecting the rectum distally, you find that the distal margin appears inadequate. What are your options at this point?

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident discusses temporary diverting ileostomy
dynamic_flow.reply: What criteria would you use to determine the need for a diverting ileostomy in this patient?

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident doesn't address postoperative surveillance
dynamic_flow.reply: The final pathology shows ypT2N0 with negative margins. What surveillance plan would you recommend?

Surgical planning including approach to TME
